qa_pairs.question: What positions did Sheu Yu-jer hold before becoming Minister of Finance, and who was the premier that appointed him?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>Sheu Yu-jer held the position of director-general of the Taxation Agency within the Ministry of Finance before becoming Minister of Finance.<cite>[S3]</cite></statement> <statement>He also served as deputy finance minister under Chang Sheng-ford by 2013.<cite>[S4]</cite></statement> <statement>Sheu Yu-jer was appointed finance minister by Premier Lin Chuan on 15 April 2016.<cite>[S5]</cite></statement>
qa_pairs.chunk:
Passage 1:
[S1] Sheu Yu-jer


# Sheu Yu-jer



**Sheu Yu-jer** (Chinese: 許虞哲; pinyin: *Xǔ Yúzhé*; 27 October 1952 – 15 February 2020) was a Taiwanese politician who served as the Minister of Finance from 20 May 2016 until 16 July 2018. [S2] ## Education

Sheu received his bachelor's degree in finance and taxation from National Chengchi University, where he was a classmate of Lin Chuan, and his master's degree in law from Harvard University in the United States. [S3] ## Career

Sheu served within the Ministry of Finance as director-general of the Taxation Agency. [S4] By 2013, he was deputy finance minister under Chang Sheng-ford. [S5] Sheu was appointed finance minister by Premier Lin Chuan on 15 April 2016. [S6] He was replaced by Su Jain-rong in July 2018. [S7] Sheu then led the Taiwan Futures Exchange. [S8] He died on 15 February 2020, aged 67.
